column4: I ran this command -  growisofs -Z /dev/scd0 -speed=1 -iso-level 4 -r /var/dar/home.1.dar    and got his error - /dev/scd0: media is not recognized as recordable DVD: A  -  I'm using distro 8.04. can someone tell me what this error is? I have burn ubuntu iso files with this burner.
is there in fact a recordable dvd in the drive? the error seems pretty clear. you've used this exact command before successfully?
no I have not use this command before. I use sony cd +rw disk. my drive is suppose to write on all media.
could you verify that your userid is a member of the "cdrom" group?
my sign on is a member of cdrom.
my sign on is a member of cdrom. Here's the entry -  cdrom:x:24:wayne
wait, did you say you were using a *CD* +RW disk?
clearly the drive is expecting a writable dvd disk, yes?
I always used cd+rw, are you saying I now have to use dvd disk.
you've always used cds with growisofs?
not with this command. I'm trying to backup my system using command line tool for the purpose.
I'm tired of trying to get various gui tool for this purpose.

yeah, the growisofs manpage does not mention CD support, and i'm fairly certain the program will fail on them. but if you're backing up a system, surely DVDs are the better choice anyhow? (well, best would be to copy your data to two removable hard drives)
I guess I'll go to staples and buy some dvd +rw.
depending on the amount you have to back up, please consider getting two removable hard drives. less money per gigabyte, easier to manage.
